document_title: Nummular eczema: Causes, signs, diagnosis, prevention
subsection_content:
Nummular eczema can appear on any part of the body, but is  rarely seen on the face and scalp. The initial signs of eczema are red, swollen bumps like insect bites, causing severe itching and blistering covered with tiny blisters. The nodules quickly join together to form large patches ranging in size from a few millimeters to several centimeters.
The patient feels itchy a lot at night. Over time, the dry patches become scaly and peeling, become rough, swollen, soft or painful, and the skin in between the patches is often dry, wrinkled, and red. (2)
subsection_title: cham dong tien.json. Symptoms of nummular eczema
